questions.text: A biker is biking at a constant speed. He sees his friend, slowly stops, and talks to his friend for awhile. Select the POSITION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant speed. He sees his friend, slowly stops, and talks to his friend for awhile. Select the VELOCITY-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant speed. He sees his friend, slowly stops, and talks to his friend for awhile. Select the ACCELERATION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant speed. He sees his friend, slowly stops, and talks to his friend for awhile. Select the MOTION MAP that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant velocity when he strikes a wall and abruptly stops. Select the POSITION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant velocity when he strikes a wall and abruptly stops. Select the VELOCITY-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant velocity when he strikes a wall and abruptly stops. Select the ACCELERATION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker is biking at a constant velocity when he strikes a wall and abruptly stops. Select the MOTION MAP that best reflects this motion.
A biker speeds up while going down a hill, then immediately starts going up a hill and slows down. Select the POSITION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker speeds up while going down a hill, then immediately starts going up a hill and slows down. Select the VELOCITY-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker speeds up while going down a hill, then immediately starts going up a hill and slows down. Select the ACCELERATION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker speeds up while going down a hill, then immediately starts going up a hill and slows down. Select the MOTION MAP that best reflects this motion.

A biker speeds up going down a hill, then bikes at a constant speed on a flat surface, and then slowly comes to a stop at an intersection. Select the POSITION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.

A biker speeds up going down a hill, then bikes at a constant speed on a flat surface, and then slowly comes to a stop at an intersection. Select the VELOCITY-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.

A biker speeds up going down a hill, then bikes at a constant speed on a flat surface, and then slowly comes to a stop at an intersection. Select the ACCELERATION-TIME graph that best reflects this motion.
A biker speeds up going down a hill, then bikes at a constant speed on a flat surface, and then slowly comes to a stop at an intersection. Select the MOTION MAP that best reflects this motion.
